medical: ADMITTING DIAGNOSIS: Right C5-C6 herniated nucleus pulposus. PRIMARY OPERATIVE PROCEDURE: Anterior cervical discectomy at C5-6 and placement of artificial disk replacement. SUMMARY: This is a pleasant, 43-year-old woman, who has been having neck pain and right arm pain for a period of time which has not responded to conservative treatment including ESIs. She underwent another MRI and significant degenerative disease at C5-6 with a central and right-sided herniation was noted. Risks and benefits of the surgery were discussed with her and she wished to proceed with surgery. She was interested in participating in the artificial disk replacement study and was entered into that study. She was randomly picked for the artificial disk and underwent the above named procedure on 08/27/2007. She has done well postoperatively with a sensation of right arm pain and numbness in her fingers. She will have x-rays AP and lateral this morning which will be reviewed and she will be discharged home today if she is doing well. She will follow up with Dr. X in 2 weeks in the clinic as per the study protocol with cervical AP and lateral x-rays with ring prior to the appointment. She will contact our office prior to her appointment if she has problems. Prescriptions were written for Flexeril 10 mg 1 p.o. t.i.d. p.r.n. #50 with 1 refill and Lortab 7.5/500 mg 1 to 2 q.6 h. p.r.n. #60 with 1 refill.
layman:
**Admitting Diagnosis:** A herniated disc at the right side of the C5‑C6 level of the neck.  

**Primary Surgery:** Removal of the damaged disc from the front of the neck at C5‑C6 and replacement with an artificial disc.  

**Summary:**  
A 43‑year‑old woman has had neck pain and pain in her right arm for some time. The pain did not improve with non‑surgical treatments, including steroid injections. A new MRI showed serious wear‑and‑tear at C5‑C6, with a disc bulging toward the center and the right side. She was told about the risks and benefits of surgery and decided to have the operation. She also chose to join a study that tests artificial disc replacements. She was randomly assigned to receive the artificial disc and had the surgery on August 27, 2007.  

After the operation she is doing well. She still feels some pain and numbness in her right arm and fingers. X‑rays of the neck (front‑to‑back and side views) will be taken this morning. If she is fine, she will be sent home today. She will see Dr. X in two weeks for a follow‑up visit, as required by the study. She should bring neck X‑rays taken before the appointment. If she has any problems, she should call the office.  

**Medications prescribed:**  
- Flexeril 10 mg, one tablet by mouth three times a day as needed (50 tablets, one refill).  
- Lortab 7.5/500 mg, one to two tablets every six hours as needed (60 tablets, one refill).
